title: Patrol69
author: Patrol69
content: Image CollectedThe ODI World Cup is going to be held in India in October and November 2023. The ODI World Cup will be held this year with a total of ten teams. Eight of the ten teams have already qualified for the main stage of the World Cup. The remaining two teams that will be selected will have to score the highest points in the qualifying round and then qualify for the main round of the World Cup.Tournament format(s):Round-robin and KnockoutHost(s):IndiaParticipants Team:10Matches:48Already Qualified Teams:1. New Zealand2. England3. Bangladesh4. India (hosts)5. Pakistan6. Australia7. Afghanistan8. South AfricaThe ICC Men's Cricket World Cup Qualifier 2023Image CollectedThe World Cup qualifiers are going to start in Zimbabwe from today. Where 10 teams have participated to play in the main stage of the World Cup, the best two teams out of the ten teams will secure the main stage of the World Cup.

comments.author: Patrol69
comments.body: Nepal has set a huge target against Zimbabwe in 50 overs.  Zimbabwe need to collect 291 runs in 50 overs to win.  Nepal's top-order batsmen were very good at scoring runs.  Kushal Bhurtel missed the century by just one run. If he could have scored a century, Nepal's innings would have been complete. Maybe that's why scores between 90 and one type are called nervous nineteen.  Zimbabwe has already entered the field against Nepal to chase the target of 291 runs. So far Zimbabwe have managed to collect 33 runs without a wicket in six overs. In order to win with such a big target, the first-line batsmen have to do well, only then it is possible to win this match against Nepal.
